VREyeParameters.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The VREyeParameters interface of the WebVR API represents all the information required to correctly render a scene for a given eye, including field of view information.

blockquote.para: This interface was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This interface is accessible through the method.

blockquote.para: The values in this interface should not be used to compute view or projection matrices. In order to ensure the widest possible hardware compatibility use the matrices provided by .

VREyeParametersMaximumFieldOfView.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The maximumFieldOfView read-only property of the interface describes the maximum supported field of view for the current eye.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VREyeParametersOffset.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The offset read-only property of the interface represents the offset from the center point between the user's eyes to the center of the eye, measured in meters.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This value should represent half the user's interpupillary distance (IPD), but may also represent the distance from the center point of the headset to the center point of the lens for the given eye.

VREyeParametersOffset.value:
A representing a vector describing the offset from the center point between the users eyes to the center of the eye in meters.
NOTEValues for the left eye will be negative; values for the right eye will be positive.

VREyeParametersRenderWidth.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The renderWidth read-only property of the interface describes the recommended render target width of each eye viewport, in pixels.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This is already in device pixel units, so there's no need to multiply by Window.devicePixelRatio before setting to HTMLCanvasElement.width.

VREyeParametersRenderWidth.value: A number, representing the width in pixels.

VREyeParametersRenderHeight.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The renderHeight read-only property of the interface describes the recommended render target height of each eye viewport, in pixels.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This is already in device pixel units, so there's no need to multiply by Window.devicePixelRatio before setting to HTMLCanvasElement.height.

VREyeParametersRenderHeight.value: A number, representing the height in pixels.

VREyeParametersMinimumFieldOfView.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The minimumFieldOfView read-only property of the interface describes the minimum supported field of view for the current eye.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VREyeParametersFieldOfView.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The fieldOfView read-only property of the interface returns a object describing the current field of view for the eye, which can vary as the user adjusts their interpupillary distance (IPD).

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.
